证据片段: the specimen assembly extensometry is made up of two parts: The LVDT mobile armature connected to the guide tube specimen and the LVDT outer transformer winding attached to the stainless steel support tube, which surrounds the guide tube (see Fig. 2)

文献ID: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_014_chunk8
证据片段: The parabolic length change recorded at the start of Cycle 1 has been attributed not to the control specimen guide tube specimens elongating, but rather to the stainless steel support tube decreasing in length.

文献ID: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_014_chunk8
证据片段: This assumption has been confirmed by length measurements made of the stainless steel support tubes before and after exposure in the reactor (see section Out-of-Reactor Elongation Measurements).

文献ID: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_014_chunk8
证据片段: Thermal Creep Specimens (Cluster 4)—No reliable in situ elongation data were obtained from the LVDTs for these specimens.

文献ID: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_014_chunk8
证据片段: All the support tubes showed a decrease in length regardless of position in the test rig indicating a temperature induced change rather than a flux effect.

文献ID: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_014_chunk8
证据片段: It has thus been assumed that the LVDT signals give an overestimate of the net elongation accumulated by each specimen during the irradiation period Cycle 1 through Cycle 5 on the order $4 0 \mathrm { - } 8 0 \mu \mathrm { m }$ .
